text.p: - Shops and restaurants close to the Slovenian border with Austria have experienced a significant fall in sales since the Ljubelj tunnel was closed over two weeks ago due to its ceiling collapsing.
- Heavy rain over the weekend flooded several buildings on the Slovenian seaside.
- Slovenia has good chances of joining NATO at its first enlargement, said participants of the international conference on NATO and Europe, organised by a group of Slovenian experts.
- Almost 10 percent of Slovenian customs officers lost their job in 1995 due to corruption.
- Slovenia's tourist revenues reached $500 million in the first half of 1996 and is expected to rise to about one billion dollars in the whole year -- on par with 1995.
- Over a quarter of a million people visited Slovenia's largest manufacturing fair in Celje, which ended on Sunday.
- An opinion poll showed 55.2 percent of Slovenians support the work of the current government.
- Slovenia's Chamber of Manufacturing said the government should try to improve payment discipline in the country and reduce the level of unregistered labour.

- Slovenia is a star among the countries of Central and Eastern Europe, credit agency Dun & Bradstreet said, giving Slovenia an unchanged rating for September and placing it behind the Czech Republic and in front of Poland.
